# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Sure, here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function with the given specifications:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)  # Split into words
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"  # Add a new line
        end
        wrapped_text *= word * " "  # Combine the wrapped word with spaces
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a test string. It exceeds the given text_width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, I've provided a sample text and set `text_width` to 10. The function `wrap_string` takes these inputs, wraps the text based on the `text_width`, and returns the wrapped version.
